content.raw:
In an ideal situation proper unit tests should be able to say if the open action is working although the close action is broken. I understand that we are not able to do that, in that case:

 * Test for open the gripper (as it is now)
 * Test for close the gripper (same code as open, with only an ASSERT_TRUE at the end of the open action to be sure it's open and all the EXPECT or ASSERT for the close action after it.

Does it makes sense?
